intro: Licania pallida, commonly known as the pale licania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas of the forest understory. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
